intro: Haplopappus ameghinoi, commonly known as the Argentine burrweed, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Argentina. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, spiny fruits that are adapted for dispersal by animals. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Haplopappus ameghinoi thrives in dry, arid environments and is well adapted to the harsh conditions of its native habitat.
